Committee for Remembering Kim Il Sung formed in Syria 
    Pyongyang, July 3 (KCNA) -- A Committee for Remembering President Kim Il Sung was inaugurated in Damascus on June 28.
 Fayez Ismail, General Secretary of the Socialist Unionist Party of Syria, was elected chairman of the committee.    
 The committee decided to hold a meeting for remembering his revolutionary life and immortal revolutionary feats and other functions on the occasion of the 9th anniversary of his demise.

articles.content:
Cuban diplomats visit Mangyongdae Children's Camp 
    Pyongyang, July 3 (KCNA) -- Ambassador Esteban Lobaina Romero and officials of the Cuban embassy here visited the Mangyongdae Children's Camp on July 2 on the occasion of the month of solidarity with the Cuban people.
 Being briefed on the fact that the camp has turned into a comprehensive centre for extracurricular education as it is equipped with all facilities needed for the camping life of children's union members under the deep care of President  Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il, the guests looked round different facilities.    
 That day they also visited revolutionary relics and historic sites on Mt. Ryongak.

articles.content:
Greetings to Communist Party of Sri Lanka
    Pyongyang, July 3 (KCNA) -- The Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea sent a message of greetings to the Central Committee of the Communist Party of Sri Lanka and all its party members on July 3 on the occasion of its 60th anniversary.
 Expressing belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two parties would further develop in the future in the idea of independence, peace and friendship, the message wished them new success in the work to protect the interests of broad working masses and strengthen the party.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il nominated as candidate for SPA at electorate meetings across DPRK
articles.content:
Greetings to President of Rwanda
    Pyongyang, July 3 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, President of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, on June 28 sent a message of greetings to Paul Kagame, President of Rwanda, on the occasion of the national holiday of its people.
 Expressing belief that the friendly ties between the two countries would continue to develop on good terms, the message wished the president and the people of Rwanda success in their work for national unity and prosperity of the country.
